						WEDNESDAY 25 APRIL 22:30 BST - BBC TWO


						FROM PROGRAMME PRODUCER ROBERT MORGAN 					
					Hello,



TRAFFICKING


A major investigation by BBC News has revealed a new kind of trafficking and exploitation of migrant workers into the UK. The BBC's been working with a Lithuanian journalist who's gone undercover to expose a corrupt labour market. 


Unscrupulous agencies are taking advantage of the widening of the European Union to dupe foreign workers into coming to Britain. Those workers end up like bonded labourers, deep in debt, paid less than the minimum wage and pushed into appalling living conditions. 


Allan Little has been working with Audrius Lelkaitus for the last three months and we have their exclusive report tonight. 


MORALITY


We have an interview with the Archbishop of Canterbury whose urging politicians to rediscover "moral energy and vision". Does he practice what he preaches as leader of the Church of England? 


Watch tonight to find out why he thinks Tony Blair should pray with George Bush.


SCOTLAND


The Scottish election campaign involves an ongoing debate about whether Scotland's economy could survive going it alone. Our Economics Editor, Stephanie Flanders, assesses the numbers to find out whose right in this devolution debate.


Newsnight is on BBC2 at 10.30pm.


Robert


ORWELL PRIZE


Newsnight has become the first television programme to win a prestigious Orwell Prize. 


The judges called Newsnight the "most precious and authoritative home for proper reporting of important stories, beautifully crafted by journalists of rare distinction".
